documentType: bank records response to grand jury subpoena
summary: This document is JPMorgan Chase Bank's response to a grand jury subpoena (Case No. 2019R01059) from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, dated August 19, 2019. It includes an affidavit from a records custodian and detailed bank statements for account number 613055768 (a Chase Premier Plus Checking account) from December 2018 through September 2019. The subpoena seeks records related to alleged violations of federal statutes including bribery, conspiracy, false statements, and obstruction.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Signed the grand jury subpoena commanding JPMorgan Chase to produce records and have a custodian testify.

connections.description: Lopez, Zenaida sent multiple Zelle payments to Robert C's bank account.
Robert C's account sent multiple Zelle payments to an entity/person labeled 'Beautiful Person'.
Berman, as U.S. Attorney, issued a grand jury subpoena for the financial records of Robert C's account.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman issues a grand jury subpoena to JPMorgan Chase Bank for records related to account 613055768, commanding a custodian to testify on September 3, 2019.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: The subpoena commanded a JPMorgan Chase custodian of records to appear before the grand jury in New York on this date.

events.title: Bank Records Produced
events.description: JPMorgan Chase's National Subpoena Processing department sends the requested bank records to the U.S. Attorney's Office in fulfillment of the subpoena.

events.title: Bank Merger
events.description: Chase Bank USA, N.A. merged with and into JPMorgan Chase Bank, N.A.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, New York, New York
keyFacts: A federal grand jury subpoena was issued for bank records related to account number 613055768, held in the name of Robert C, as part of an investigation into alleged violations of U.S. criminal statutes including bribery (18 U.S.C. ยง 201), conspiracy (ยง 371), false statements (ยง 1001), and obstruction (ยง 1519).

The account shows regular deposits labeled as 'Agri Trees 310 Fed Sal' and 'Vacp Tress 310 Xxva Bone', suggesting possible federal salary or benefit payments, alongside numerous everyday expenses, Uber rides, and Zelle transfers.
The account incurred multiple 'Insufficient Funds Fees' ($34 each) throughout 2019, indicating periods of low balance and overdraft activity.
Numerous Zelle payments were made from the account to a recipient labeled 'Beautiful Person' and received from individuals including Lopez, Zenaida and Michele Pinckney-Wiggins.
The bank records cover the period from December 2018 through September 2019, providing a detailed transaction history subpoenaed by federal prosecutors.
